title: BARKXAI: A LIGHTWEIGHT POST-HOC EXPLAIN-ABLE METHOD FOR TREE SPECIES CLASSIFICATION WITH QUANTIFIABLE CONCEPTS
author: Yunmei Huang (Purdue University), Zachary Nelson Horve (Purdue University), Songlin Hou (Worcester Polytechnic Institute), Songlin Fei (Purdue University), ...
relevance_why: This paper's approach to explainable AI (XAI) using quantifiable concepts may be relevant for interpreting audio models or any complex audio-based method as it emphasizes clear and human-understandable explanations, which can be adapted for understanding audio classification tasks.
field: Social and Economic Aspects of ML-Interpretability
background: Tree species classification using bark images involves identifying different tree species based on visual characteristics of bark textures.
contribution: BARKXAI introduces a novel lightweight method to provide human-interpretable explanations for tree species classification models, achieving quantifiable concept insights without heavy computational burdens.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Prior methods like TCAV and attribution-based XAI approaches struggle to explain texture-dominant images, particularly those without distinct local features.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work uses parameterized operators to define concepts dynamically rather than relying on pre-collected external datasets, making it more practical and efficient.

key_innovation: The method utilizes operators instead of fixed concept images to analyze global visual features, focusing on the intuitive aspects of classification relevant to domain experts.
real_world_impact: Enhancing interpretability in tree species classification can lead to better forestry management and conservation efforts by providing clearer insights into model decision processes.
limitations: The performance may depend heavily on the design of operators, and the method might require expert knowledge for adaptation across different domains.

new_terms.explainable AI (XAI): **Explainable AI (XAI)** refers to techniques and methods in artificial intelligence that aim to make the internal workings of AI systems understandable to humans.
new_terms.quantifiable concepts: **Quantifiable concepts** are measurable features or attributes derived from data, allowing for clearer analysis and interpretation in models.

open_sourcing: Source code will be released upon acceptance.
